fields.headline: Corrections and clarifications
fields.bodyText: • Fittingly, an article about made-up words mangled the name of the school attended by Roald Dahl as “Renton”, rather than Repton (Why Dahl’s swishfigglers and snozzcumbers make perfect sense to children, 28 February, page 3). • One of the property listings included in a Shortcuts item was said to be “a two-bed Brighton semi”. The house was actually in Bristol (The Rightmove hall of shame…, 25 February, page 2, G2). Other recently corrected articles include: Once-in-a-generation rail fare reform? More like Ryanair on steroids Up to 100 journalists accused of breaking Pell suppression order face possible jail terms Sparking joy: use Marie Kondo’s approach to declutter your mind This week’s best home entertainment: from Alan Partridge to True Detective
